Docs.summary: Provides a default implementation of members.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Contracts define the types and methods used by the host and the add-in. All contracts must derive from <xref:System.AddIn.Contract.IContract>. This class provides the default implementation of <xref:System.AddIn.Contract.IContract> members.

Docs.returns: A random number that identifies a token.
Docs.exception: All previously acquired tokens have been revoked. No further tokens are available.

Docs.summary: When overridden in an add-in-side adapter, releases native resources held by the adapter.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is called by the system when all the lifetime tokens that have been acquired from the current <xref:System.AddIn.Pipeline.ContractBase> instance have been revoked. Use this method to clean up any native resources held by the adapter, and to signal to the adapted views that they should do the same.

Docs.summary: Reflects over the instance of a contract and returns the pointer if the current object implements that contract.
Docs.returns: The pointer to an interface, or if the contract is not implemented.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method can be overridden.

Docs.param: The lifetime lease object that is used by the remoting lifetime service.
Docs.summary: Requests a sponsoring client to renew the lease for the specified object.
Docs.permission: for full trust for the immediate caller. This member cannot be used by partially trusted code.

Docs.summary: Removes the specified token from the list of outstanding lifetime tokens.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the token is not in the list of outstanding lifetime tokens, this method throws an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>.

Docs.exception: is not found in the list of outstanding lifetime tokens.
